hpnicfPortal.name: hpnicfPortal
hpnicfPortal.description: The MIB module is used for managing portal.

hpnicfPortalMaxUserNumber.name: hpnicfPortalMaxUserNumber
hpnicfPortalMaxUserNumber.description: Specify the maximum number of online users, the value to be set should meet the following two conditions: 1. Less than or equal to hpnicfPortalUserNumberUpperLimit. 2. Greater than or equal to one. The default value is equal to hpnicfPortalUserNumberUpperLimit.

hpnicfPortalCurrentUserNumber.name: hpnicfPortalCurrentUserNumber
hpnicfPortalCurrentUserNumber.description: The current number of users connecting to the portal.

hpnicfPortalStatus.name: hpnicfPortalStatus
hpnicfPortalStatus.description: It indicates the portal status. enabled: Portal is enabled on one or more interfaces. disabled: Portal is not enabled on any interface.

hpnicfPortalNasId.name: hpnicfPortalNasId
hpnicfPortalNasId.description: The nas id of this device.

hpnicfPortalServerTable.name: hpnicfPortalServerTable
hpnicfPortalServerTable.description: This table defines the name and URL of portal server. It can not be created and destroyed by MIB.

hpnicfPortalServerEntry.name: hpnicfPortalServerEntry
hpnicfPortalServerEntry.description: There is a row in this table for each name and URL of portal server. It is indexed using the object hpnicfPortalServerName.

hpnicfPortalServerName.name: hpnicfPortalServerName
hpnicfPortalServerName.description: It is the index of the table of hpnicfPortalServerTable, it shows the name of the portal server.

hpnicfPortalServerUrl.name: hpnicfPortalServerUrl
hpnicfPortalServerUrl.description: It shows the uniform resource locator to the portal server. Users which have not logon to portal will be redirected to the portal server according to hpnicfPortalServerUrl. The value is consisted of protocol, IP address and relative path. For example: HTTP://10.1.1.1/portal It is not configurable when the portal server has been enabled.

hpnicfPortalServerPort.name: hpnicfPortalServerPort
hpnicfPortalServerPort.description: It shows the UDP port of the portal server. The port will be used when client sends packets to portal server. Default value is 50100. It is not configurable when the portal server has been enabled.

hpnicfPortalIfInfoTable.name: hpnicfPortalIfInfoTable
hpnicfPortalIfInfoTable.description: This table describes the portal information on some interface.

hpnicfPortalIfInfoEntry.name: hpnicfPortalIfInfoEntry
hpnicfPortalIfInfoEntry.description: There is a row in this table for a interface on which portal has been enabled. It is indexed using the object ifIndex.

hpnicfPortalAuthReqNumber.name: hpnicfPortalAuthReqNumber
hpnicfPortalAuthReqNumber.description: It shows the number of authentication request messages which are sent by portal module to AAA module.

hpnicfPortalAuthSuccNumber.name: hpnicfPortalAuthSuccNumber
hpnicfPortalAuthSuccNumber.description: It shows the number of authentication success response messages which are sent by AAA module to portal module.

hpnicfPortalAuthFailNumber.name: hpnicfPortalAuthFailNumber
hpnicfPortalAuthFailNumber.description: It shows the number of authentication failure response messages which are sent by AAA module to portal module.

hpnicfPortalIfServerTable.name: hpnicfPortalIfServerTable
hpnicfPortalIfServerTable.description: This table describes the portal information on some interface.

hpnicfPortalIfServerEntry.name: hpnicfPortalIfServerEntry
hpnicfPortalIfServerEntry.description: There is a row in this table for a interface on which portal has been enabled. It is indexed using the object ifIndex.

hpnicfPortalIfServerIndex.name: hpnicfPortalIfServerIndex
hpnicfPortalIfServerIndex.description: It is the index of the table of hpnicfIfPtServerTable, it shows the index of the portal server.

hpnicfPortalIfServerUrl.name: hpnicfPortalIfServerUrl
hpnicfPortalIfServerUrl.description: It shows the uniform resource locator to the portal server. Users which have not logon to portal will be redirected to the portal server according to hpnicfPortalServerIfUrl. The value is consisted of protocol, IP address and relative path. For example: HTTP://10.1.1.1/portal It is not configurable when the portal server has been enabled.

hpnicfPortalIfServerRowStatus.name: hpnicfPortalIfServerRowStatus
hpnicfPortalIfServerRowStatus.description: This object is responsible for managing the creation, deletion and modification of rows, which support active status and CreateAndGo, Destroy operation. To create a new row, portal server must be specified. To destroy an existent row, the portal server MUST NOT be referred by interface.

hpnicfPortalIfVlanNasIDTable.name: hpnicfPortalIfVlanNasIDTable
hpnicfPortalIfVlanNasIDTable.description: This table describes the interface on which portal has been enabled, the Vlan that the interface belongs to and the NAS ID to which the Vlan is bound.

hpnicfPortalIfVlanNasIDEntry.name: hpnicfPortalIfVlanNasIDEntry
hpnicfPortalIfVlanNasIDEntry.description: There is a row in this table for a interface on which portal has been enabled, the Vlan that the interface belongs to and the NAS ID to which the Vlan is bound. It is indexed using the object ifIndex and Vlan that the interface belongs to.

hpnicfPortalIfVlanNasIDIfIndex.name: hpnicfPortalIfVlanNasIDIfIndex
hpnicfPortalIfVlanNasIDIfIndex.description: It is the index of the table of hpnicfPortalIfVlanNasIDTable, it shows the interface on which portal has been enabled.

hpnicfPortalIfVlanNasIDVlanID.name: hpnicfPortalIfVlanNasIDVlanID
hpnicfPortalIfVlanNasIDVlanID.description: It is the index of the table of hpnicfPortalIfVlanNasIDTable, it shows the Vlan that the interface belongs to.

hpnicfPortalIfVlanNasIDNasID.name: hpnicfPortalIfVlanNasIDNasID
hpnicfPortalIfVlanNasIDNasID.description: It is the NAS ID to which the Vlan is bound to.

hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleTable.name: hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleTable
hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleTable.description: This table describes SSID portal-free rule(s) allows specified users to access specified external websites without portal authentication.

hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleEntry.name: hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleEntry
hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleEntry.description: There is a row in this table for SSID portal-free rule. It is indexed using the object Index.

hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleIndex.name: hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleIndex
hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleIndex.description: It is the index of the table of hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleTable, it shows the index of the SSID portal-free rule.

hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleSrcSSID.name: hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleSrcSSID
hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleSrcSSID.description: The SSID match against the packet's source SSID.

hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleRowStatus.name: hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleRowStatus
hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleRowStatus.description: This object is responsible for managing the creation, deletion and modification of rows, which support active status and CreateAndGo, Destroy operation.

hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleSrcSpot.name: hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleSrcSpot
hpnicfPortalSSIDFreeRuleSrcSpot.description: The spot match against the packet's source spot.

hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvTable.name: hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvTable
hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvTable.description: This table describes the configration of MAC Trigger Portal server.

hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvEntry.name: hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvEntry
hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvEntry.description: There is a row in the table for MAC Trigger Portal server. It is indexed using the object Index.

hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvIndex.name: hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvIndex
hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvIndex.description: It is the index of the table of hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvTable, it shows the index of the MAC Trigger Portal server.

hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvIPAddrType.name: hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvIPAddrType
hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvIPAddrType.description: The type of MAC Trigger Portal server IP address. While other types of addresses are defined in the InetAddressType textual convention, and DNS names, a classifier can only look at packets on the wire.

hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvIP.name: hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvIP
hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvIP.description: It shows the IP address of MAC Trigger Portal server.

hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvPort.name: hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvPort
hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvPort.description: It shows the UDP port of MAC Trigger Portal server. The port will be used when client sends packets to MAC Trigger Portal server. Default value is 50100.

hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvRowStatus.name: hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvRowStatus
hpnicfPortalMacTriggerSrvRowStatus.description: This object is responsible for managing the creation, deletion and modification of rows, which support active status and CreateAndGo, Destroy operation.

hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfTable.name: hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfTable
hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfTable.description: This table describes the configration of Portal MAC Trigger on interface.

hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfEntry.name: hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfEntry
hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfEntry.description: There is a row in the table for Portal MAC Trigger configuration on interface. It is indexed using the object Index.

hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfIfIndex.name: hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfIfIndex
hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfIfIndex.description: It is the interface index and the index of hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfTable.

hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfDetctFlowPerio.name: hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfDetctFlowPeriod
hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfDetctFlowPerio.description: It shows the period of detecting the user flow when MAC Trigger and Portal is enabled. The unit is second.

hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfThresholdFlow.name: hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfThresholdFlow
hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfThresholdFlow.description: It shows the threshold flow of the user to triggering authentication when MAC Trigger and Portal is enabled. The unit is byte.

hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfRowStatus.name: hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfRowStatus
hpnicfPortalMacTriggerOnIfRowStatus.description: This object is responsible for managing the creation, deletion and modification of rows, which support active status and CreateAndGo, Destroy operation.

hpnicfPortalFreeRuleTable.name: hpnicfPortalFreeRuleTable
hpnicfPortalFreeRuleTable.description: This table describes portal-free rule(s) allows specified users to access specified external websites without portal authentication.

hpnicfPortalFreeRuleEntry.name: hpnicfPortalFreeRuleEntry
hpnicfPortalFreeRuleEntry.description: There is a row in this table for portal-free rule. It is indexed using the object Index.

hpnicfPortalFreeRuleIndex.name: hpnicfPortalFreeRuleIndex
hpnicfPortalFreeRuleIndex.description: It is the index of the table of hpnicfPortalFreeRuleTable, it shows the index of the portal-free rule.

hpnicfPortalFreeRuleSrcMac.name: hpnicfPortalFreeRuleSrcMac
hpnicfPortalFreeRuleSrcMac.description: The MAC address to match against the packet's source MAC address.

hpnicfPortalFreeRuleAddrType.name: hpnicfPortalFreeRuleAddrType
hpnicfPortalFreeRuleAddrType.description: The type of IP address used by this classifier entry. While other types of addresses are defined in the InetAddressType textual convention, and DNS names, a classifier can only look at packets on the wire.

hpnicfPortalFreeRuleSrcAddr.name: hpnicfPortalFreeRuleSrcAddr
hpnicfPortalFreeRuleSrcAddr.description: The IP address to match against the packet's source IP address. This may be a DNS name or an IPv4 or IPv6 prefix. hpnicfPortalFreeRuleSrcPrefix indicates the number of bits that are relevant.

hpnicfPortalFreeRuleSrcPrefix.name: hpnicfPortalFreeRuleSrcPrefix
hpnicfPortalFreeRuleSrcPrefix.description: The length of the CIDR Prefix carried in hpnicfPortalFreeRuleSrcAddr. In IPv4 addresses, a length of 0 indicates a match of any address; a length of 32 indicates a match of a single host address, and a length between 0 and 32 indicates the use of a CIDR Prefix. IPv6 is similar, except that prefix lengths range from 0..128.

hpnicfPortalFreeRuleDstAddr.name: hpnicfPortalFreeRuleDstAddr
hpnicfPortalFreeRuleDstAddr.description: The IP address to match against the packet's destination IP address. This may be a DNS name or an IPv4 or IPv6 prefix. hpnicfPortalFreeRuleDstPrefix indicates the number of bits that are relevant.

hpnicfPortalFreeRuleDstPrefix.name: hpnicfPortalFreeRuleDstPrefix
hpnicfPortalFreeRuleDstPrefix.description: The length of the CIDR Prefix carried in hpnicfPortalFreeRuleDstAddr. In IPv4 addresses, a length of 0 indicates a match of any address; a length of 32 indicates a match of a single host address, and a length between 0 and 32 indicates the use of a CIDR Prefix. IPv6 is similar, except that prefix lengths range from 0..128.

hpnicfPortalFreeRuleSrcPort.name: hpnicfPortalFreeRuleSrcPort
hpnicfPortalFreeRuleSrcPort.description: The source port allows users to access.

hpnicfPortalFreeRuleDstPort.name: hpnicfPortalFreeRuleDstPort
hpnicfPortalFreeRuleDstPort.description: The destination port allows users to access.

hpnicfPortalFreeRuleRowStatus.name: hpnicfPortalFreeRuleRowStatus
hpnicfPortalFreeRuleRowStatus.description: This object is responsible for managing the creation, deletion and modification of rows, which support active status and CreateAndGo, Destroy operation.

hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleTable.name: hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleTable
hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleTable.description: This table describes a portal-forbidden rule does not allow specified users to access specified external websites.

hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleEntry.name: hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleEntry
hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleEntry.description: There is a row in this table for portal-forbidden rule. It is indexed using the object Index.

hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleIndex.name: hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleIndex
hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleIndex.description: It is the index of the table of hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleTable, it shows the index of the portal-forbidden rule.

hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleSrcMac.name: hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleSrcMac
hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleSrcMac.description: The MAC address to match against the packet's source MAC address.

hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleAddrType.name: hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleAddrType
hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleAddrType.description: The type of IP address used by this classifier entry. While other types of addresses are defined in the InetAddressType textual convention, and DNS names, a classifier can only look at packets on the wire.

hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleSrcAddr.name: hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleSrcAddr
hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleSrcAddr.description: The IP address to match against the packet's source IP address. This may be a DNS name or an IPv4 or IPv6 prefix. hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleSrcPrefix indicates the number of bits that are relevant.

hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleSrcPrefix.name: hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleSrcPrefix
hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleSrcPrefix.description: The length of the CIDR Prefix carried in hpnicfPortalFreeRuleSrcAddr. In IPv4 addresses, a length of 0 indicates a match of any address; a length of 32 indicates a match of a single host address, and a length between 0 and 32 indicates the use of a CIDR Prefix. IPv6 is similar, except that prefix lengths range from 0..128.

hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleDstAddr.name: hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleDstAddr
hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleDstAddr.description: The IP address to match against the packet's destination IP address. This may be a DNS name or an IPv4 or IPv6 prefix. hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleDstPrefix indicates the number of bits that are relevant.

hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleDstPrefix.name: hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleDstPrefix
hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleDstPrefix.description: The length of the CIDR Prefix carried in hpnicfPortalFreeRuleDstAddr. In IPv4 addresses, a length of 0 indicates a match of any address; a length of 32 indicates a match of a single host address, and a length between 0 and 32 indicates the use of a CIDR Prefix. IPv6 is similar, except that prefix lengths range from 0..128.

hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleSrcPort.name: hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleSrcPort
hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleSrcPort.description: The source port does not allow users to access.

hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleDstPort.name: hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleDstPort
hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleDstPort.description: The destination port does not allow users to access.

hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleRowStatus.name: hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleRowStatus
hpnicfPortalForbiddenRuleRowStatus.description: This object is responsible for managing the creation, deletion and modification of rows, which support active status and CreateAndGo, Destroy operation.

hpnicfPortalServerLost.name: hpnicfPortalServerLost
hpnicfPortalServerLost.description: This trap is generated when the device finds that the portal server is unreachable, the portal server's name is hpnicfPortalServerName, and the portal server's IP is hpnicfPortalServerIP, and the portal server's port is hpnicfPortalServerPort, and the portal server has been enabled.

hpnicfPortalServerGet.name: hpnicfPortalServerGet
hpnicfPortalServerGet.description: This trap is generated when the device finds that the state of portal server changes from unreachable state to reachable, the portal server's name is hpnicfPortalServerName, and the portal server's IP is hpnicfPortalServerIP, and the portal server's port is hpnicfPortalServerPort, and the portal server has been enabled.

hpnicfPortalStatAuthReq.name: hpnicfPortalStatAuthReq
hpnicfPortalStatAuthReq.description: It shows the total number of portal authentication requests from the portal server.

hpnicfPortalStatAckLogout.name: hpnicfPortalStatAckLogout
hpnicfPortalStatAckLogout.description: It shows the number of logout requests from the portal server.

hpnicfPortalStatNotifyLogout.name: hpnicfPortalStatNotifyLogout
hpnicfPortalStatNotifyLogout.description: It shows the number of logout requests from the access device.

hpnicfPortalStatChallengeTimeout.name: hpnicfPortalStatChallengeTimeout
hpnicfPortalStatChallengeTimeout.description: It shows the number of challenge from the portal server without response.

hpnicfPortalStatChallengeBusy.name: hpnicfPortalStatChallengeBusy
hpnicfPortalStatChallengeBusy.description: It shows the number of device-busy responses for challenges from the portal server.

hpnicfPortalStatChallengeFail.name: hpnicfPortalStatChallengeFail
hpnicfPortalStatChallengeFail.description: It shows the number of challenges from the portal server with failure response.

hpnicfPortalStatAuthTimeout.name: hpnicfPortalStatAuthTimeout
hpnicfPortalStatAuthTimeout.description: It shows the number of authentication requests from the portal server without responses.

hpnicfPortalStatAuthFail.name: hpnicfPortalStatAuthFail
hpnicfPortalStatAuthFail.description: It shows the number of authentication requests from the portal server with failure responses.

hpnicfPortalStatPwdError.name: hpnicfPortalStatPwdError
hpnicfPortalStatPwdError.description: It shows the number of password errors.

hpnicfPortalStatAuthBusy.name: hpnicfPortalStatAuthBusy
hpnicfPortalStatAuthBusy.description: It shows the number of device-busy responses to authentication requests from the portal server.

hpnicfPortalStatAuthDisordered.name: hpnicfPortalStatAuthDisordered
hpnicfPortalStatAuthDisordered.description: It shows the number of disordered authentication packets from the portal server.

hpnicfPortalStatAuthUnknownError.name: hpnicfPortalStatAuthUnknownError
hpnicfPortalStatAuthUnknownError.description: It shows the number of unknown errors.

hpnicfPortalStatAuthResp.name: hpnicfPortalStatAuthResp
hpnicfPortalStatAuthResp.description: It shows the number of authentication response messages which are sent by device to portal server.

hpnicfPortalStatChallengeReq.name: hpnicfPortalStatChallengeReq
hpnicfPortalStatChallengeReq.description: It shows the number of challenge request messages which are sent by portal server to device.

hpnicfPortalStatChallengeResp.name: hpnicfPortalStatChallengeResp
hpnicfPortalStatChallengeResp.description: It shows the number of challenge response messages which are sent by device to portal server.

hpnicfPortalStatHttpReq.name: hpnicfPortalStatHttpReq
hpnicfPortalStatHttpReq.description: It shows the number of http request messages which are sent by portal user to device.

hpnicfPortalStatHttpResp.name: hpnicfPortalStatHttpResp
hpnicfPortalStatHttpResp.description: It shows the number of http response messages which are sent by device to portal user.

hpnicfPortalPktStaReqAuthNum.name: hpnicfPortalPktStaReqAuthNum
hpnicfPortalPktStaReqAuthNum.description: It shows the total number of portal authentication requests from the portal server.

hpnicfPortalPktStaAckAuthSuccess.name: hpnicfPortalPktStaAckAuthSuccess
hpnicfPortalPktStaAckAuthSuccess.description: It shows the total number of the response to REQ-AUTH packet of portal server including error code 0 in the packet, that is authentication success.

hpnicfPortalPktStaAckAuthReject.name: hpnicfPortalPktStaAckAuthReject
hpnicfPortalPktStaAckAuthReject.description: It shows the total number of the response to REQ-AUTH packet of portal server including error code 1 in the packet, that is rejected by server.

hpnicfPortalPktStaAckAuthEstablish.name: hpnicfPortalPktStaAckAuthEstablish
hpnicfPortalPktStaAckAuthEstablish.description: It shows the total number of the response to REQ-AUTH packet of portal server including error code 2 in the packet, that is the link is already established.

hpnicfPortalPktStaAckAuthBusy.name: hpnicfPortalPktStaAckAuthBusy
hpnicfPortalPktStaAckAuthBusy.description: It shows the total number of the response to REQ-AUTH packet of portal server including error code 3 in the packet, that is the system is busy.

hpnicfPortalPktStaAckAuthAuthFail.name: hpnicfPortalPktStaAckAuthAuthFail
hpnicfPortalPktStaAckAuthAuthFail.description: It shows the total number of the response to REQ-AUTH packet of portal server including error code 4 in the packet, that is authentication fail.

hpnicfPortalPktStaReqChallengeNum.name: hpnicfPortalPktStaReqChallengeNum
hpnicfPortalPktStaReqChallengeNum.description: It shows the total number of portal challenge requests from the portal server.

hpnicfPortalPktStaAckChallengeSuccess.name: hpnicfPortalPktStaAckChallengeSuccess
hpnicfPortalPktStaAckChallengeSuccess.description: It shows the total number of the response to challenge packet of portal server including error code 0 in the packet, that is challenge is success.

hpnicfPortalPktStaAckChallengeReject.name: hpnicfPortalPktStaAckChallengeReject
hpnicfPortalPktStaAckChallengeReject.description: It shows the total number of the response to challenge packet of portal server including error code 1 in the packet, that is challenge is rejected by server.

hpnicfPortalPktStaAckChallengeEstablish.name: hpnicfPortalPktStaAckChallengeEstablish
hpnicfPortalPktStaAckChallengeEstablish.description: It shows the total number of the response to challenge packet of portal server including error code 2 in the packet, that is the link is alreadys established.

hpnicfPortalPktStaAckChallengeBusy.name: hpnicfPortalPktStaAckChallengeBusy
hpnicfPortalPktStaAckChallengeBusy.description: It shows the total number of the response to challenge packet of portal server including error code 3 in the packet, that is the system is busy.

hpnicfPortalPktStaAckChallengeAuthFail.name: hpnicfPortalPktStaAckChallengeAuthFail
hpnicfPortalPktStaAckChallengeAuthFail.description: It shows the total number of the response to challenge packet of portal server including error code 4 in the packet, that is authentication fail.
